description: From Middle French viscéral, from Latin viscera, plural of viscus (“any internal organ of the body”).

adjectives.description: visceral (comparative more visceral, superlative most visceral)

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Of or relating to the viscera—internal organs of the body.
Having to do with the response of the body as opposed to the intellect, as in the distinction between feeling and thinking.

examples: Love is of all other the inmost and most visceral affection; and therefore called, by the apostle, 'bowels of love.'
